timeline.message:
Added PowerSummaryTest - (Task #746)

Created a Power Summary above two Power Equipments. Compared the
expected values with test values.
Added PowerSummaryTest to AllTests

---
Task #746: SWTBot Test Cases for Power Summary

timeline.bodyText: We also had to a new concept in another test case and decided to add it in ASwtBotTestCase instead of the concrete test case. Not sure if it makes sense for this concept, because I don't know if there are other UseCases we could run SWT tests for with this concept.
timeline.author: JAmmermann-DLR

replies.bodyText: I would rather put the core concepts ( tests / core / ps ) into ATestCase but not this concept as it is really about some domain content... And what benefit would we have if it would be in the ATestCase?
replies.author: franzTobiasDLR

replies.bodyText: Ok then we leave it there
replies.author: JAmmermann-DLR

timeline.bodyText: Can we remove the empty Strings?
timeline.author: JAmmermann-DLR

replies.bodyText: Well, it's the simplest way that I know how to convert the double values to strings...
replies.author: franzTobiasDLR

replies.bodyText:
I actually agree that using + "" to convert to String isnt the nicest way.
I would suggest String.valueOf(AOCS_POWER).  It may be a little bit longer in terms of number of characters, but this makes it really clear for the reader whats being done.
replies.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.author: JAmmermann-DLR

timeline.bodyText: I think we have a save function in ASwtBotTestCase we could call instead?
timeline.author: JAmmermann-DLR
JAmmermann-DLR

timeline.message:
Use save() from ASwtBotTestCase - (Task #746)



---
Task #746: SWTBot Test Cases for Power Summary

timeline.bodyText:
If we open the powerSummary I think we can use the SWTBot API to do the assertion with something like this:
assertText(expectedMinPower, bot.textWithLabel(PowerSummary.PROPERTY_MINPOWER));
(or something similar)
In general it looks a bit weird that the before part opens the PowerSummary editor and then this test case opens the configuration tree editor.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

replies.bodyText: Ah ok, I thought that I was supposed to test, if the power summary in the configuration tree editor is showing the correct numbers.
replies.author: Anna-Lena-DLR

timeline.bodyText:
Why do we need this save here?
Would it not be sufficient to save at the end of the test setup?
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.message:
Use final variables for table columns - (Task #746)

& get rid of unnecessary code
